summary: This is an FBI 302 form documenting an interview with a BOP employee regarding observations made by inmate Steven Lopez about unusual document shredding at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York around August 15, 2019, shortly after the suicide of Jeffrey Epstein. The employee reports Lopez's account of a white man with a Southern accent involved in shredding 'more than the usual amount' of documents, which the employee surmised might be related to the BOP After Action team investigating Epstein's death.

persons.name: Steven Lopez
persons.context: Inmate at MCC with a gate pass who performs janitorial duties; reported observing and participating in unusual document shredding to the interviewed BOP employee.

persons.name: Sony Lam/Ne N'Diaye
persons.context: Mentioned third-hand as having been told by an 'Officer' that Jeffrey Epstein should be confined in the 10 South wing of MCC.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The deceased inmate whose suicide prompted a BOP After Action investigation; the unusual document shredding observed was surmised to be related to this investigation.

connections.description: Lopez witnessed and reported on document shredding activities that the interviewing employee surmised were related to the investigation into Epstein's suicide.
As former MCC Warden, N'Diaye was reportedly given advice regarding Epstein's confinement location (10 South wing).

events.title: Unusual Document Shredding at MCC
events.description: Inmate Steven Lopez reported to a BOP employee that he observed and was asked to help with shredding an unusually large amount of documents, involving a white man with a Southern accent.

events.title: FBI Interview of BOP Employee
events.description: An FBI and DOJ-OIG agent interviewed a BOP employee regarding the inmate's report of document shredding at MCC after Epstein's death.

events.title: BOP Employee Reports to FBI
events.description: The interviewed BOP employee called the FBI to file a report about the document shredding incident described by inmate Lopez.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein's Suicide
events.description: The suicide of inmate Jeffrey Epstein at MCC, which prompted a BOP 'After Action' investigation. The document shredding was surmised to be related to this investigation.

locations: Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC), Brooklyn, New York

keyFacts: Inmate Steven Lopez reported observing an unusually large amount of document shredding at MCC around August 15, 2019, involving a white man with a Southern accent.
The BOP employee interviewed surmised the shredding might be connected to the BOP 'After Action' team investigating Jeffrey Epstein's suicide.
The BOP employee reported the incident to the FBI on or about August 23, 2019.
Third-hand information reported that an 'Officer' told former MCC Warden Sony Lam/Ne N'Diaye that Epstein should have been confined in the 10 South wing of MCC.
The document is an official FBI 302 record of an interview conducted jointly with the DOJ Office of the Inspector General.
